***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | Monks have a head start with the divine. They start with only a simple weapon of their choice, a potion of divine ambrosia, a robe, and an orb of light to guide them. However, when they worship a god for the first time, their spiritual training gives them a piety boost. |

## Contents

- [1 Preferred Species](#Preferred_Species)
- [2 Racial Restrictions](#Racial_Restrictions)
- [3 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [4 Starting Skills and Stats](#Starting_Skills_and_Stats)
- [5 Special](#Special)
- [6 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [7 History](#History)
- [8 References](#References)

## Preferred Species

[Mountain Dwarf](/Mountain_Dwarf "Mountain Dwarf"), [Merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk"), [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle"), [Troll](/Troll "Troll"), [Demonspawn](/Demonspawn "Demonspawn") and [Armataur](/Armataur "Armataur") are the recommended races if you pick a Monk Background.

## Racial Restrictions

[Demigods](/Demigod "Demigod") cannot be Monks, as they refuse to worship a god.

## Starting Equipment

Some [species](/Species "Species") may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

- +0 [weapon of choice](/Weapon_of_choice "Weapon of choice") ([hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe"), [spear](/Spear "Spear"), [short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword"), [falchion](/Falchion "Falchion"), [mace](/Mace "Mace"), or [unarmed](/Unarmed "Unarmed"))
- +0 [robe](/Robe "Robe")
- [orb](/Orb "Orb") of [light](/Light "Light")
- [Potion of ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia")

## Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' [aptitudes](/Aptitude "Aptitude").

- [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting"): 3
- Chosen Weapon's Skill: 3
- [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging"): 3

Choosing Monk adds 3 to your starting [Strength](/Strength "Strength"), 2 to your starting [Intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence") and 7 to your starting [Dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity").

## Special

Monks do not start with a god, but automatically gain \*\* [piety](/Piety "Piety") when they first convert to a god.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The following gods have special properties with monks:

- [Ashenzari](/Ashenzari "Ashenzari"): Monks are provided the first set of curses much sooner.
- [Gozag](/Gozag "Gozag"): Monks skip the entry fee.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)
- [Ru](/Ru "Ru"): Monks are immediately given a set of sacrifice options to make upon conversion.
- [Uskayaw](/Uskayaw "Uskayaw"): No effect.
- [Xom](/Xom "Xom"): No effect.

The Monk bonus *does* stack with that of a [faded altar](/Faded_altar "Faded altar").

## Strategy

The main appeal of this background is the piety boost you gain upon choosing a god, especially when worshiping a god who offers bonuses at 1\* or 2\* of piety, such as [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru") or [Nemelex](/Nemelex "Nemelex"). On the other hand, surviving until you find a suitable god to worship can be more challenging than with better-equipped backgrounds like [Fighter](/Fighter "Fighter") or [Gladiator](/Gladiator "Gladiator").

The orb of light will reveal [invisible](/Invisible "Invisible") enemies nearby and increase your [to-hit](/To-hit "To-hit") (i.e. accuracy). However, it also lowers your [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") and prevents you from going invisible. Note that the orb doesn't increase enemies' accuracy against you, though.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), Monks did not start with an [orb](/Orb "Orb") of [light](/Light "Light"), but started with 2 [Stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") skill.
- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Monks received a [potion of ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia"); most other backgrounds also gained an extra consumable.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), monks could not choose a starting weapon - instead they always started with unarmed combat.
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), there was no piety bonus gained upon choosing a god.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [religion.cc:3472](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.32.0/crawl-ref/source/religion.cc#L3472) (0.32.0)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [religion.cc:3294](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.32.0/crawl-ref/source/religion.cc#L3294) (0.32.0)

Monk

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.32: This article is up to date for the latest stable release of Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup.
Monks have a head start with the divine. They start with only a simple weapon of their choice, a potion of divine ambrosia, a robe, and an orb of light to guide them. However, when they worship a god for the first time, their spiritual training gives them a piety boost.

Contents

  • 1 Preferred Species
  • 2 Racial Restrictions
  • 3 Starting Equipment
  • 4 Starting Skills and Stats
  • 5 Special
  • 6 Strategy
  • 7 History
  • 8 References

Preferred Species

Mountain Dwarf, Merfolk, Gargoyle, Troll, Demonspawn and Armataur are the recommended races if you pick a Monk Background.

Racial Restrictions

Demigods cannot be Monks, as they refuse to worship a god.

Starting Equipment

Some species may receive different items based on their unique restrictions.

  • +0 weapon of choice (hand axe, spear, short sword, falchion, mace, or unarmed)
  • +0 robe
  • orb of light
  • Potion of ambrosia

Starting Skills and Stats

These are adjusted by your species' aptitudes.

  • Fighting: 3
  • Chosen Weapon's Skill: 3
  • Dodging: 3

Choosing Monk adds 3 to your starting Strength, 2 to your starting Intelligence and 7 to your starting Dexterity.

Special

Monks do not start with a god, but automatically gain ** piety when they first convert to a god.[1] The following gods have special properties with monks:

  • Ashenzari: Monks are provided the first set of curses much sooner.
  • Gozag: Monks skip the entry fee.[2]
  • Ru: Monks are immediately given a set of sacrifice options to make upon conversion.
  • Uskayaw: No effect.
  • Xom: No effect.

The Monk bonus does stack with that of a faded altar.

Strategy

The main appeal of this background is the piety boost you gain upon choosing a god, especially when worshiping a god who offers bonuses at 1* or 2* of piety, such as Okawaru or Nemelex. On the other hand, surviving until you find a suitable god to worship can be more challenging than with better-equipped backgrounds like Fighter or Gladiator.

The orb of light will reveal invisible enemies nearby and increase your to-hit (i.e. accuracy). However, it also lowers your stealth and prevents you from going invisible. Note that the orb doesn't increase enemies' accuracy against you, though.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, Monks did not start with an orb of light, but started with 2 Stealth skill.
  • In 0.29, Monks received a potion of ambrosia; most other backgrounds also gained an extra consumable.
  • Prior to 0.19, monks could not choose a starting weapon - instead they always started with unarmed combat.
  • Prior to 0.10, there was no piety bonus gained upon choosing a god.

References

  1. ↑ religion.cc:3472 (0.32.0)
  2. ↑ religion.cc:3294 (0.32.0)
